titles.title: Providing for the further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1335) making emergency supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1993, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-36, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1335. Previous question shall be considered as ordered except motion to recommit. Upon adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order to further consider the bill in the House and all points of order against the bill shall be waived. A specified amendment is in order. It shall be in order to consider an amendment offered by the chairman of the Committee on Appropriations. The amendment shall be considered as read, shall be debatable for 10 minutes, shall not be subject to amendment, and shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question. All points of order against the amendment shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 19.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 185 (Roll No. 86).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/17/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the further consideration of H.R. 1335 (emergency supplemental appropriations).
